author: Maria Armental
title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Raises Shareholder Return Target to $7 Billion Under New CEO - WSJ
text:
Rising sales of storage and networking devices powered Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co.â€™s core business during the holiday quarter, helping the company raise its annual profit targets while boosting planned returns to shareholders.
The Silicon Valley company, born from the 2015 split of Hewlett-Packard, also recorded a fivefold rise in profit for its fiscal first quarter, helped by the U.S. tax overhaul.
